articles.title: Los Angeles Dodgers trade for Chicago Cubs reliever Chris Martin, sources say
articles.description: The Dodgers have added to their bullpen by trading for Cubs right-handed reliever Chris Martin, sources told ESPN.
articles.content:
The Los Angeles Dodgers have added to their bullpen by trading for Chicago Cubs right-handed reliever Chris Martin, sources told ESPN's Buster Olney on Sunday.

articles.title: Retirement of franchise sacks leader Ryan Kerrigan closes an era for Washington football
articles.description: Former Washington defensive lineman Ryan Kerrigan said it was "really cool" to see the response from fans and former teammates after he announced his retirement from football after 11 seasons in the NFL on Friday.

articles.title: San Francisco 49ers DT Maurice Hurst set for surgery on torn biceps
articles.description: Niners defensive tackle Maurice Hurst suffered a torn biceps in Friday's practice and will need surgery, likely ruling him out for the 2022 season, according to coach Kyle Shanahan.

articles.title: Kyle Busch open to pay cut, options outside NASCAR as he looks for 2023 seat
articles.description: Kyle Busch's longtime sponsor is pulling out of NASCAR at the end of the season, and if Joe Gibbs Racing doesn't find a deep-pocketed replacement, Busch will have to find a job elsewhere.
articles.content:

articles.title: Report -- San Diego Padres, Joe Musgrove closing on 5-year, $100 million deal
articles.description: Joe Musgrove, coming off his first All-Star Game appearance, is closing on a five-year deal worth $100 million with his hometown San Diego Padres, according to the New York Post.

articles.title: Jacksonville Jaguars sign K Elliott Fry, cut Andrew Mevis
articles.description: The Jaguars have signed kicker Elliott Fry and cut rookie Andrew Mevis, who hit former Cowboys head coach Dave Campo with a badly missed field goal attempt during training camp.
